Heritrix 3.1.1 (5 instance crawl 1200 threads per instance)

As our crawl is progressing, we are finding that it is using more than 
we had expected.  As you can see below, 6.9 tb are taken up by the warc 
files and various reports and logs.  The other files and directories are 
nominal.

It appears that the state directory must be taking up the additional 5TB 
of space.  The big question is can any the state's directory content be 
deleted?

  30T   12T   19T  39% /bos/tmp16

3.0T    20120105162057/warcs

3.9T    20111223051704 <- size includes warcs
3.0T    20120105162057 <- size includes warcs
192K    action
94M     checkpoints
14G     converted
7.2G    diversions
224M    scratch
548M    seed.txt
27M     opt-out.surts
?       state

I have configured the instances to create a checkpoint every hour.  Once 
I have confirmed that a current checkpoint is valid and used to be 
recovered, can all or most (maybe saving one every 12 hours ) of the 
previous checkpoints be deleted?

Looking in the state's directory, I have noticed that a recent 
checkpoint contains around 42000 files.  The size of the checkpoint 
directories in the state directory vary (see sample below).  Can you 
explain why?
